caption:
This photograph depicts a river, partially covered with ice, flowing through a landscape. The view is from an elevated perspective, looking along the river as it moves away from the viewer towards a pair of industrial structures in the distance. The waters of the river appear rough and turbulent with patches of white ice and darker areas of moving water, creating a textured appearance.

The sky, overcast and gray, suggests a cold, gloomy day. The edges of the riverbanks are not clearly visible, indicating the photograph was taken during a time when the daylight is fading, possibly dusk. There are no visible human activities or people; the focus is entirely on the natural and industrial elements of the scene.

In the distance beyond the river, silhouetted against the sky, are industrial structures which might be part of a dam, bridge, or some other form of infrastructure, adding a hint of human presence in this otherwise natural landscape.

Overall, the photo conveys a sense of quiet and isolation, emphasizing the rugged beauty of a winter river scene amidst an industrial backdrop.
title: Waste pulping water is released after secondary treatment into a slough in the Snohomish estuary. Brownish color retained after treatment has no affect on the purity of the water.
